trans-unit.source: Provides the base class for serializing a reflection primitive within the object graph.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.MemberCodeDomSerializer> class is a "meta" serializer; that is, is a serializer that does not serialize part of the object graph, but instead serializes a reflection primitive within the object graph.

For example, a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.MemberCodeDomSerializer> would be associated with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> in order for it to serialize a property.

<xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.MemberCodeDomSerializer> objects enable constructs, such as properties and events, to be logical, rather than requiring them to have a physical backing in code.
Unlike <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomSerializer> classes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.MemberCodeDomSerializer> objects must be able to deserialize.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.MemberCodeDomSerializer"></xref> class.
Serializes the given member descriptor on the given value to a statement collection.
This method actually performs the serialization.
When the member is serialized the necessary statements will be added to the statements collection.
The serialization manager to use for serialization.
The object to which the member is bound.
The descriptor of the member to serialize.
Determines if the given member should be serialized.
This method returns `true` if the given member descriptor should be serialized, or `false` if there is no need to serialize the member.
The serialization manager to use for serialization.
The object to which the member is bound.
The descriptor of the member to serialize.
`true`, if the member described by descriptor should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
